inktober.alt: A sketch of a person wearing a ghost as a backpack.
inktober.description: On day 1, the sketchbook I made was still drying, so I did my sketch elsewhere and pasted it in. My son is into 'spooky ghosts' right now, so this backpack got ghostified.

inktober.alt: A sketch of an arm picking up a rock and discovering a smoke-breathing snake underneath.
inktober.description: Woops! Made a mistake, scribbled it out and turned it into a little snake puffing smoke and .. magic? Discovered hiding under a rock.

inktober.alt: A sketch of a cat wearing human-sized winter boots.
inktober.description: After I drew this, I was bothered by the fact that the prompt was plural and I had only made space to draw one boot, so I added a tiny little boot in the bottom corner.

inktober.alt: A sketch of a thatch-roofed hut on stilts in the water.
inktober.description: Looks like a nice place to escape to for a week..

inktober.alt: A sketch of a view through binoculars; on one side, a bird looks through at high magnification, and on the other side, a mountain view.
inktober.description: No comment...

inktober.alt: A sketch of the Fellowship's silhouette against a mountain backdrop. (References Lord of the Rings)
inktober.description: Things started looking better (...sometimes) once I started choosing subject matter I was interested in.

inktober.alt: A sketch of passports for Rivendell and Gondor.
inktober.description: I was reading The Lord of the Rings in October, so I had LotR on the brain.

inktober.alt: A sketch of a path through the woods.
inktober.description: This is what happens when I try to draw from my imagination (a few previous sketches suffer from this same approach).

inktober.alt: A sketch of a sunflower.
inktober.description: The finished product here made me smile. I'm no good with drawing, but once in a while these happy accidents appear.

inktober.alt: A sketch of a monarch butterfly.
inktober.description: I'm a native plant and pollinator/beneficial bugs evangelist. These guys are so, so important to our ecosystem.

inktober.alt: A sketch of the pigeon from Mo Willems' books about to eat a hot dog, and looking back at a little duckling who's peeking at him from off the page.
inktober.description: Shoutout to Mo Willems for giving us hilarious books that parents and young ones can both love!

inktober.alt: A sketch of a tree in the middle ground and mountains in the background, under a starry night sky.
inktober.description: Dang it. I really liked this one, but was trying to make the whitespace into clouds and couldn't do it. I pivoted to mountains, ish, and left it at that.

inktober.alt: A sketch of Jack Sparrow at the helm of his ship, from the Pirates of the Caribbean.
inktober.description: The first Pirates of the Caribbean movie was a deep obsession of college-freshman-Maggie's.

inktober.alt: A sketch of Strider, sitting in shadow in the pub of the Inn of the Prancing Pony in Bree, from The Lord of the Rings.
inktober.description: 'What his right name is I've never heard: but he's known round here as Strider.'

inktober.alt: A sketch of a stack of three books, sitting next to an alethiometer, from the His Dark Materials trilogy.
inktober.description: Inspiration was hard to find for this prompt. I kept coming back to the books used by scholars to interpret the Alethiometer in the Book of Dust and His Dark Materials books; maybe a bit abstract, but I went with it.

inktober.alt: A sketch of an Uruk-hai.
inktober.description: Well... this didn't go as planned. Very cool Uruk-hai on screen. Very weird off of my pen.

inktober.alt: A sketch of a journal.
inktober.description: I was initially going to title this 'There and Back Again', making it Bilbo's journal, but ran out of steam. Maybe I'll add it someday.

inktober.alt: A sketch of the Intention Craft, from the His Dark Materials trilogy.
inktober.description: Inspiration was low. I opted for a low-effort depiction of the Intention Craft from His Dark Materials.

inktober.alt: A sketch of the perilous path out of the world of the dead, from The Amber Spyglass.
inktober.description: The path out of the world of the dead from The Amber Spyglass.

inktober.alt: A sketch of the world of the dead, from The Amber Spyglass.
inktober.description: More from The Amber Spyglass - the cover of one of my editions.

inktober.alt: A sketch of Brett and Jemaine from Flight of the Conchords, rapping.
inktober.description: Couldn't think of anything inspired for 'Rhinocerous', so went with 'Rhymenocerous' (Flight of the Conchords).

inktober.alt: A sketch of a camp, with a tent and a fire.
inktober.description: Low-effort here. Wasn't inspired, though can think of better ideas after the fact!

inktober.alt: A sketch of a cartoon fox.
inktober.description: This is Rusty, a fox from one of my toddler's books. 'Rust' as a prompt wasn't sparking much.

inktober.alt: A sketch of Bilbo Baggins running out of Hobbiton towards his first great adventure.
inktober.description: Young Bilbo, running off toward adventure.

inktober.alt: A sketch of a scarecrow.
inktober.description: I was actually in the mood for a prompt like this one. The Autumn theme worked for me and I went for a straight-up sketch of a scarecrow.

inktober.alt: A sketch of an old analog camera.
inktober.description: My grandpa had a camera like this, and it was eventually passed along to me. I spent a lot of time with it earlier in life.

inktober.alt: A sketch of a road with a brick wall blocking it.
inktober.description: Blah. Was not in the mood for this prompt.

inktober.alt: The word 'jumbo' and the date '10/28/24'.
inktober.description: ... And even less in the mood for this one. I still have no inspiration or interest in sketching 'Jumbo'.

inktober.alt: A sketch of a sign that reads 'onward'.
inktober.description: The only place to go.

inktober.alt: A sketch of a violin.
inktober.description: ...Just wish this was better centered on the page!

inktober.alt: A sketch of the Eye of Sauron and Barad-dûr in Mordor.
inktober.description: Landmark of landmarks... Barad-dûr in Mordor.
